text:
When httpd.conf contains ServerTokens Prod, server-status shows only Server 
Version: Apache.

I think server-status should always show all/full tokens, because IMO 
ServerTokens is used as restriction for public and not as restriction for 
admins.
I also think there should be an option to disable the Server: header completely 
(via ServerTokens None).
creator: OlafvdSpek@GMail.Com

text:
The developers have a policy that if you want to lie or completely hide
the Server: header, you'll need to hack the code.  I tend to agree with
this.

As far as mod_status, I'd hazard a guess that if we were to make the change
you wanted, we'd soon get a bug report asking for it to be put back the way
it is.  And it certainly isn't worth making separately configurable.

Thanks for using Apache!
creator: slive@apache.org
OlafvdSpek@GMail.Com
text: Why would you want to show less than full tokens in mod_status?

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
Because you want to use mod_status to determine what is in the Server: header?

Because you want to make mod_status open to the public?

Since the whole argument of hiding various parts of this information in various
places doesn't make any sense to me, I can't really tell.  But I think it is
a waste of developer time to go around twidling this in various places.  (But
if someone wants to use their time to do it, that's fine with me.)
